required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Helicobacter Pylori Resistance. A Study of Morbidity, Immunological and Clinical Phenotypes

brief_summary.textblock: The main goal of the study was to characterize the morbidity, immunological, microbiolical and clinical phenotypes of patients with treated- resistance to Helicobacter pylori (HP) infection, and the effect of triple therapy including the levofloxacin. Control groups were newly diagnosed, previously infected and never infected HP patients

detailed_description.textblock: See Nestegard O, et al. PLOS ONE | https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0238944 September 23, 2020

primary_outcome.measure: Characterization of patients with chronic HP infection resistant to previous conventional triple therapy
primary_outcome.description: Clinical data including endoscopy, histology, microbiological data including resistance measurements, immunological data (mucosal tranacrips), effect of triple therapy
endoscopic description of mucosa bye endoscopy
Histological characterizations of inflammation (Sydney) of gastric mucosa
Immunological mucosal characterizations of pro- and antiinflammatory cytokine transcript (PCR)
HP microbiology sensitivity to metronidazol, amoxicillin, clarithromycine, levofloxacin and tetracycline

arm_group.description: Patients with treatment resistance to Helicobacter pylori treatment registered at GI-unites from 1990-2012 and included from 2010 to 2012. These patients were treated with a triple therapy of levofloxacin, amoxicillin and proton inhibitor for 10 days
Patients with newly diagnosed Helicobacter pylori infection from 2010-2012.These patients were treated with a triple therapy of clarithromycin, amoxicillin and proton inhibitor for 10 days
Patients with previously Helicobacter pylori infection included from 2010-2012.
Patients with previously Helicobacter pylori infection included from 2010-2012.

intervention.description: Triple therapy of Helicobacter pylori including two antibiotics and a proton inhibitor for 10 days

biospec_descr.textblock: RNA measure of mucosal transcripts, mucosal histology, cultures including antibiotic sensitivity to HP from mucosal biopsies

study_pop.textblock:
1. Patients referred to Gastrointestinal (GI) unite in the time periode from 1990 to 2010 and defined as resistant to triple Helicobacter pylori (HP) treatment
2. Patients referred to GI unite in the time periode from 2010 to 2012 due to opper GI complaints. Included were patients a) newly diagnosed HP, b) previously successful triple HP therapy, and c) never HP infected

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patients referred to a GI- unite with upper GI complains and performing an upper endoscopy -
Exclusion Criteria:
Patients with severe chronic diseases and not willing to participate

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Gastroenterology, Norwegian Artic University/Universiuty of Troms√∏, Norway

clinical_study.keyword: Gastrointestinal Symptom Rating Scale, Helicobacter pylori resistance, levofloxacin, Sydney score
